description:
Did a pick up order of a small cheese pizza on Sunday evening. Came to about $13-14. I liked the pizza, was quite good. The tomato sauce was different than other pizza spots in SF, darker and not as tangy, but I could tell the sauce was seasoned well. I think it could have used more sauce, but cheese was a good amount. 

They have nice tasting parm cheese on side. Crushed red pepper were good.
author: Shruti D.

description:
This has been my go-to pizza joint in the neighborhood/city for like... I can't even remember how long. 

It's seriously my favorite place for a solid, nothin-too-fancy, delivery pizza. The regular crust is thick but it's a good airy dough w nice outer crunch (and great w/ a little olive oil or other dip/spread). Also a big plus, they're nice and fast, and it always arrives hot out at my place on the other side of the 280. 

There's a few joints the deliver around here where you can get a slightly cheaper pizza, but I depend on Pizza Express whenever I'm in the mood. I know they're gonna have what I want - and they always deliver :)
author: Kilian F.

description:
Peperoni, bacon and chicken pizza were a hit with a bunch of guys. All agreed it was decent for the price and in terms of taste for a quick pizza delivery. Very basic pizza's with a thick crust but you can certainly add more toppings if you wish for an additional fee.

The pizza arrived hot with melted cheese (that wasn't chewy or rubbery). So for a fast food joint, ordered via Grubhub this should be a staple for everyone.
author: Carmen P.

description:
Not sure why this place is at 3.5* or 2 $'s. 

Great no thrills/no frills place where you can get a cheap slice (which I've found to be super rare in SF). You get a bit of a sticker shock seeing slices go for $3, but it's a double slice! Ordered 3 slices. 2 was enough to fill a medium box, and they had to put a 3rd slice in a smaller box. 

2 slices was more than enough for me (and I eat a lot, and I had just finished a run), so I would definitely say this is a 1$ place, rather than a 2$. 

Quality: Pizza was super fresh (granted this was on Halloween so they were selling fresh slices of cheese/pepperoni only). 

Taste: everything you want in a non-fancy pizza. Toppings were good. Cheese was good. Sauce was good. Crust was good. 

Great local spot.
author: Nathan K.

description: Great pizzas! Large size means large indeed. So far, all the pizzas we've ordered have been delicious.
author: JonJon W.

description: Since I moved to the City a couple years ago I ordered from Pizza Express all the time. The last 2 experience have been horrible. Last time the delivery was fast but the pizza was old and cold. And this review is about my order a month ago it was in draft lol
author: Patricia B.

description: This is going to sound maybe a little ridiculous, but their salads are shockingly good. And their pizza by the slice are always a hit. Definitely a takeout type of ambiance.
author: Natalie T.

description: How do you give zero stars? My family has been ordering from here for over a decade from Bayview (not even 10mins from Cortland Avenue where the shop is located) - YET, the pizza still comes at questionable quality and time. On two different occasions recently, we've received parmesan cheese with mold in it. Another time, where half the Parmesan was used from the canister. Today- pizza comes late AND after calling to check on the eta, it's the wrong pizza. Not sure if they ha e new management, because it's NEVER been bad service like this. But know that I have never had a yelp app account until today. 4th bad experience is enough. Feel bad for the driver, not even his fault. But I'm definitely shocked AF at these high ratings.
author: Samira N.

description:
Very solid "hole in the wall" style pizzeria. I walked in on a breezy Saturday afternoon and was served promptly. I ordered two slices, but the lady at the counter told me their single slices are "really more like doubles". When I got the slice, it was the size of a standard large slice but had a cut down the middle. 

The pizza is NY style but on the slightly crispier, slightly breadier side of things. There was plenty of cheese and tomato sauce, and the toppings were good. Overall the restaurant looked and felt simple and clean, though the space was somewhat awkwardly organized with a large employees only section and really not meant for groups of people to come and eat. That said, space is always tricky in SF :)  I'd be down to try their delivery.

Also for those cashless types strolling in the neighborhood, they do have a $10 credit card minimum.
author: Ryan S.

description:
This place is like two blocks away from my house but I just recently started eating here about a year ago. I USED to order from here like once a week but since I've gone Keto had to cut back :(

Anyways my favorite thing about this place is their pizza sauce. I don't know what it is but I love the stuff - it's so garlicky and flavorful and thick. I love it! Sometimes I just go there with an empty mason jar and ask for them to fill it up and I just pay for the sauce 

I like thick crust pizzas and they definitely have thick bready crusts. And the cheese is so melty and hot when you order... they do NOT skimp on the toppings. Oh and I really love Hawaiian pizza (lol I am not a pizza snob) and they have one of the best. I just love the amount of toppings they put on and it's well balanced between the ingredients (ham to pineapple ratio). 

I want to be clear though: I personally give this place 5 stars because of my own personal preferences of pizza. I love sauce (I always get extra to dip my pizza in vs ranch), thick crusts (so I can dip it in the sauce), and mostly veggie/ cheesy pizzas vs ones with a bunch of meat. 

I think everyone has their favorite pizza place. I personally have like 5-10 based on what kind of pizza I want at the moment! This one is def like top 3 because I found my favorite pizza sauce
author: Jewel S.

description: The best pizza in San Francisco hands down. I've never had us pizza so moist so great all the toppings delicious all the toppings fresh it was just a great pizza for me and it looks like this is gonna be my permanent pizza place here in San Francisco which is Pizza express restaurant located at 813 Courtland Ave. I won't lead you wrong these people know their pizza pie.
author: Evangela W.

description:
This used to be my favorite pizza place! Used to be... now it's ok, not delicious as it used to be but still quality food. The reason for my two stars, the delivery experience isn't always the best. Sometimes your food comes perfectly hot and leaving you feeling like it came right out the oven, and other times it's cold like the pizza you get at Costco - when you finally make it home it's cold and tasteless haha you need to warm it up to bring the flavors back to life! 

Ps. Did the sizes get smaller for the pizza?? The extra large used to be HUGE!! Now it feels like a large, a smaller large at that.. 

Anyway the last order was an XL pep and mushrooms with TWO orders of buffalo wings.. came on time but I only got one order of wings. So I called back and was promised that it will be delivered in 25 minutes. 30 minutes pass and I call back. Promised again 25 minutes. Called again, promised again, 25 minutes. Last call I placed I was pissed off, asked if customers matter to them, ranted for a bit and to be promised ONE MORE TIME!! 25 minutes. So my son stayed up to wait for it. Well actually he stayed up to play video games and I went to sleep because I start work at 4am the next day. No delivery made at all. 

So right now, I'm like F you guys, not because of the wings, but because of the lies. If you pay with hard earned money, AND TIP WELL, be sure to receive what you pay for, simple as that. Next time say you're busy, we'll credit you.. something!! But to keep lying. F you guys.
author: Jose P.

description: Good Pizza! I like this place. Been about 6 times in the last 3 months and happy! Great dough with good flavour. Good toppings. Nice people! Our go to local pizza joint now!
author: Scundy B.

description:
Pizza is always awesome been ordering pizza here for years.  Service is great and very fast deliver. However I tried the ribs and salad dinner portion for 20$ dollars last week and I was disappointed in the ribs to fatty salad was good. Very large portions I prefer baby back ribs.
Pizza always awesome 
Thank you
author: Sergei Z.

description: The homies. For over priced pizza everywhere in the CITY they one of the few places left that don't tax.  Tip the nice people :)
author: Alejandra B.

description: Order the double pepperoni with extra cheese, The Victoria specialty pizza and it was absolutely delicious. We usually pass on the crust but the dough they used was so tasty that we ate the whole slice. Next time I'm in the City, I will definitely be returning here.
author: Mariano Q.

description: Take a look inside and how they prep the food it's not sanitary at all. The cook dropped the baking pan on the floor when he was done with it and kicked aside with his foot. I looked at the floor and it was gross. Worst part is I eat it and feel sick.
author: Dara S.

description: Heads up: the menu board prices are wrong, use the paper menu instead. Slightly annoyed that the cashier didn't mention that as I ordered, and that I was charged more than expected. The food was otherwise good, the chef's salad is generous in size, has plenty of meat and cheese, the veggies were fresh, and was overall tasty. It's awesome that slices are made to order! I got one with Canadian bacon & pineapple, it was very tasty, although much doughier than I'd like. The cashier was super friendly and nice.
author: Dan B.

description: This was our first experience with pizza express. Unfortunately, somewhat disappointing. The pizza was OK. Nothing to brag about. Very thick crust. Maybe great for some people like that. The reason for two stars, with the deceptive a menu. The menu stated that our 14 inch medium pizza was $21 but we were charged $27. When I asked about that, I was told "our prices have changed". A rather steep price increase for a mediocre pizza. Too many other pizza parlors around to be mediocre
author: Bill B.

description: This is the first time I ordered from pizza express. Why on earth does my vegetarian pesto pizza have red sauce on it? I never thought I would have to specify no red sauce on a pesto pizza. There is so much sauce in fact all the topping slid off into a wet gooey lump. The onions and tomatoes are practically raw like they were sprinkled on after. Does not taste bad but my stomach is already upset from the red sauce I really can't eat. I was too hungry to not eat it.... Live and learn I guess. The delivery was fast and the deliverer was friendly so I want to maybe try them again. But next time I'm calling on the phone and specifying thin crust and no wet red stuff!
author: Leann W.

description: We ordered from here last night.  It was through grub hub.  Under my wife's name Chelsea.  Our normal pizza place was closed on a Friday (odd)  so we found this place on grub hub.  I want to start with the customer service.  I had called and a lady answered she was super nice very polite.  Told me our pizzas just left.  The boxes that the pizza comes in are so cute and cool looking. I love them.  We got the Greek one with the feta hamburger pesto and tomatoes.  This pizza is so good.  I love the fact it is refreshing.  It isn't a heavy feeling pizza.  Very tasty pesto. Good amount of cheese and topping.  The crust is a good thickness and texture.  Absolutely delish.  The other pizza was the one with onions sausage olives bacon pepperoni.  This pizza gives me life.  I have never had pizza with bacon and sausage.  Man that pizza is awesome.  I usually put ranch on my pizza and for this pizza it was not needed. It is that good.  All the flavors are balanced nothing over powers the other flavors.  It is very good. They also give you fresh parm cheese so fresh that it melted no big deal it still got used.  Congratulations pizza express you got 2 new customers.  Awesome pizza
author: Jennifer B.

description: I stop by this place every time I'm in San Francisco. I cannot get enough of their pizza and they really do have the best pizza in SF. Their pizza is very delicious and come with thick dough crust. I recommend this place to anybody who loves pizza like me. Paul and his family has always been good to me. They give me great discount and treat me well whenever I stop by just for their pizza.
author: Paul M.

description:
REVIEW IS FOR **DELIVERY**

I've had the pizza a few times already, I've only been inside of their place ONCE to pick up a pizza. 

I've had this pizza and I love it, their crust is soft, the delivery time is faster than other pizza places. I've called once and used the app, sometimes I don't trust the app to order my food, but it worked out well. 

When they delivered it to my work place, they called me to let me know they were outside (since there is no parking in front) I waited by the front door, he double parked and was very nice. Make sure you ask for Plates, Napkins, Red pepper and cheese, they will give it to you in a bag. 

If you order a certain size (I think XL) you'll get a free soda, I think that's a good deal!!! 

Their cheese pizza is very good, I would order it over and over and over again, but I also love my -mushroom, sausage, green onion- combination. They should do a special deal for City Employees, I think we would order more often if there was!!! 

After this review, I think I am going to have some pizza during my birthday month! YAY!
author: Eugenia W.

description: Great pizza. Great delivery. I've ordered from them several times and they are very prompt.
author: Micah B.

description: The pizza was great!  However, lost a star due to last weekend's nonsence.  My boyfriend called to order last weekend and was told they were too busy and we were too far away more than 2 miles.   Now we are 1.5 miles or less and they have delivered here before.  Used my Eat24 app and over tipped to make sure they didn't tell that lie again.  1 star for customer service.  4 for the food
author: Stephanie N.

description: This place is great! Delicious pizza they make from scratch and an added plus they have great wings and ribs too. Friendly atmosphere and they get you your order on time if you choose delivery. My favorite is the cortland special. I only wish i lived closer, I'll be back soon for sure! Great to order for parties, Sunday football, or if you're just craving pizza.
author: Kaylee B.

description: This was a very "meh" pizza. The pizza was doughy and chewy and maybe I'm just used to thin crust, but I wasn't crazy about it. Also, the "garlic loaf" was buttered toast with their pizza sauce. It was a bit of a let down and I wish I would've ordered from somewhere else.
author: Hannah W.

description: all slices are made fresh and delicious. Slices are 3 bucks & 60 cents per topping.. bomb dot com
author: Candida P.

description: Very nice people.  Ordered for some delivery. Delivery man was nice.  Crust is very good, but pizza sauce isn't very good. Toppings were chopped so poorly.  You get big chunks of onions.
author: Marie Erika E.

description:
This is definitely mine and my boyfriends favorite pizza place in San Francisco. Even if we are out of the city, we will travel all the way from San Mateo just to come here. This place has the best pizza ever. Delicious, delicious, delicious. We always order a half and half large. Usually we get the Aloha Hawaiian and the cortland special. They do come with a free drink if you order a large or extra large pizza. I have been coming here for year and I have to say, I am never as satisfied with them because they are just so amazing. Also they are quick with time when you pick up and ask for delivery. Price wise they are decent (regular) so I can't complain. 

The staff are super nice and they are helpful when you can't figure out what kind of pizza you want. Therefore my first time coming I always ask for recommendations. I always recommend friends to come here because there is no place like pizza express.
author: Rhoddavie M.

description:
I ordered delivery from these guys tonight through Amazon Prime. There was a used latex glove in my salad. 

Enough said.

Also, the pizza was flavorless and bland.
author: Aaron G.

description: Try the BBQ chicken pizza with bacon! I promise that you will not regret it! It truly is amazing :D will be back again for seconds... Thirds... And fourths :D
author: Jessie F.

description:
Well they tried. I'll start with the bad and leave you with the good:

Bad: I repeatedly asked for "black" olives. I got green (don't get me wrong, green olives rock - sometimes!). You should get what you ask for, or be told they don't have what you want. 
I asked for ranch on the side and it wasn't delivered.
One tiny pack of Parmesan cheese. Really? No peppers and just the one packet of cheese. Skimp much?
Lastly, there was a LOT of exposed crust. The sauce and cheese made it about 3/4 on the pizza.

The good: The crust was tasty, the cheese was good.

Overall: BAD. Pay attention and deliver a good pizza. Otherwise, no repeat business
author: Lisa H.

description:
I'm a person who doesnt trust reviews. If I see one negative I usually skip a place so that makes it really hard for me to choose anything. I didn't want to choose this place but im glad I did. It was so tasty. 

Crust 
-soft yet firm but fluffly enough that the crust is like soft toasted bread. 

Cheese 
great tasting with the right amount of gooeyness

Toppings 
Pepperonis were tasty not burnt at all and the pesto sauce was great mixed with the red sauce. I ordered extra peperoni so they definitely didnt skimp there. Lots of topping. 

Overall look and presentation 
Was a beautiful looking pizza 
Wasnt super oily but oily enough in a good way  
Definitely looked like it was made with love
author: Nia B.

description: It shouldn't be too hard to make a pizza but this place can't even do that  the first and last time I order a pizza from this place under cook runny pizza greasy!!!
author: Ramon E.

description:
Wings and pizza too salty
Order pepperoni  pizza
Delivery was fast and pizza hot
But you can't eat it to salty
author: Margarita L.

description: The pizza was ok. We ordered a combination which didn't have many veggies. The crust was way too thick.
author: Gabriela H.

description:
The pizza we got was pretty bad.  We ordered a "create your own" pizza with 3 toppings.  The pizza was supposed to have tomato sauce and did not.  Basically, it was bread with cheese and a few veges.  

The service was very good and the pizza came early.
author: Michelle I.

description: Just picked up a large double pepperoni and double sausage and after being too full to start my forth slice i just thought I would update my review to commend the guys at pizza express for actually giving me what I ordered. Plenty of pepperoni and tons of sausage. Never skimping on the cheese either. This place deserves all 5 stars definitely. I should also mention the guys there are very polite and competent.
author: Jaime G.

description: The chicken wings here are very juicy and tasty takes a little more time to be prepared but is worth it.. The pizza looks and tastes fresh.
author: Shashank D.

description: I have never been a big fan of thick crust pizza. The only thick crust I liked was Blondie's. I've ordered from here a few times and so far it has not been disappointing at all. When I request extra sauce and extra cheese, they definitely don't scrimp out! And even though it's a thick crust, it's never chewy or doughy like some other places. This is definitely my favorite go to pizza place right now. Oh, and their amaretto cheesecake slices are delicious too!
author: Jennifer W.

description: I love this pizza place they are amazing and always on time and need to say pizza always on point
author: Norma M.

description: Pizza was OK, it took forever and a half for them to make a pie. The guy making the pie had a major attitude.
author: Josnne R.

description: I work close by and this is our favorite Pizza place to order from. I love their Cortland's Special, with grilled chicken, sun dried tomatoes, spinach, artichoke hearts, fresh garlic. It instantly became a favorite between all my coworkers. I also love their Chef's Salad with lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes, carrots, ham, cheese, turkey and peperoncini and it's huge! Enough to feed about 4 - 5 people or more sometimes in our case.
author: Valerie N.

description: We've been going here a while. The pizza is fantastic! They really go all out to help you if there is a problem. Tonight was no exception. One of the pizzas was wrong so I called and spoke with them they asked a bunch of questions which was fine but when all was said and done, it turned out to be my own fault. They still corrected my mistake free of charge and got the pizza here to my door within 30 minutes. I recommend them extremely highly.
author: michelle b.

description: Best pizza! Fresh toppings.  The right amount of crisp and softness to the dough.  They use real sausage. See the pic.
author: Hesham H.

description: We just ordered the Aloha pizza with the rib dinner. My wife is in heaven! My buddies always order the rib dinners at work and they are always happy with the food and portions. Pizza Express never lets me down. The pizza and ribs always hit the spot!
author: T R.

description:
This place just received its 3rd strike from me. I won't mention the first two blunders, just tonight's unfortunate events. We've had great pizza from them before, that's why we've given them repeat business. We had guests join us for the season premier of Walking Dead and we wanted pizza, so we went with Pizza Express.

The pizza came on time but when it came, the delivery guy said "sorry but the box is kind of wet, could you check it?" I looked it, it looked like the toppings slid off but it looked salvageable. I signed the soaking wet receipt and still gave the driver a tip.

When we opened the pizzas and did further inspection, we saw puddles of pink watery tomato sauce on the side of the box and even on top of the pizza. Also, almost half of the cheese and meat moved to one side, making the crust soggy. Our guests still dove in with gratitude but the pizza was just utterly embarrassing. When we lifted the cheese off the pizza, you couldn't tell there was tomato sauce because it was so watery. We decided to just return it.

We went back to Pizza Express to get a refund. They were cool about it but the driver tried to reason out that I said they were okay: hello... I'm not trying to do a full pizza inspection outdoors in my arms that I'm planning on feeding to guests that drove out here, let alone you knew the boxes were wet and still hoped I would be cool with it.

Definitely we won't be ordering from them again.
author: Daniel V.

description: Amazon delivery review. I loved this pizza. The crust and sauce were delicious, which is always what I find to be most important. The crust was fluffy and crispy, and the sauce had a nice little kick to it. The wings were what I would expect, nothing too crazy. For delivery, I was totally satisfied with how the pizza and wings were both still hot when they got to me. I'll definitely be ordering from here again!
author: Joey S.

description: Horrible service. They should name this place rude express. Came to pick up a pizza and the owner shouted I'm so busy I can't even drink water as I was asking him for my order. Go here if you like rude owners
author: Tin N.

description: My FAVORITE PIZZA no joke! It's super meaty and cheesy, its perfect! I like how the dough is a little crunchy outside and fluffy inside, it taste delicious! (Not like cardboard lol) ..
author: Alyssa R.

description: Best Hawaiian pizza I've ever had!! It's called the Aloha and it's worth the drive if they don't deliver to tour area. Never had a bad pizza from Pizza Express
author: Amanda M.

description: I love to stop by here when I'm in the mood for Pizza. They have been here for a while and have a wide range of choices. Gotta come try them out of your in the neighborhood.
author: Helani H.

description:
Hey. I like them!!

Their cheese pesto is spot on. Once I forgot to bring all my money and they still gave it to me and just said I could come back tomorrow to pay the rest. That's awesome customer service. The staff is friendly and the pizzas come out fast. 

Thanks guys!
author: Rachel T.

description: Hmmm. Lemme start of by the best pizza in san pancho! When I crave pizza, first thing comes to mind is pizza express mushroom and pepp. Oh my gosh the crust is good and thick. The sauce is good unlike other pizza spots there sauce kills the pizza. So if you want good pizza pick this place!
author: Priscilla P.

description: I think I've ordered pizza from here so many times now that they've learned what my order is based on my phone number! I always order an extra large pizza with garlic. Soooo good. They don't take very long to deliver either. They usually take about 30-35 minutes. And whenever I call in to ask for delivery, the people that work there are super nice. This is my go to spot for pizza!!
author: Robyn S.

description: Pizza was great..   Everything taste fresh..   Great delivery man..    He was very polite..    The delivery was on time :)
author: KayLee N.

description:
Delicious crust and sauce, but the cheese and meat were not my favorite.

Very fresh, however.
author: Ellie M.

description: Very nice and friendly staff! Pizza took only 30 mins or so to deliver..pizza was fresh and delicious, crust was so soft and tender...the BBq buffalo wings was amazing! Highly recommended! Definitely my new pizza joint! I'm one happy customer!
author: Dusoh S.

description:
I come a far away land of Daly City in search of the BEST pizza.  My yelp friends I'm proud and honored to say I've found the answer.  

Pizza Express.
author: Amro R.

description: I love their pizza, service, and delivery. I try others and always go back to pizza express.
author: wayz W.

description: I have always been a huge fan of the Bernal Heights area and I am so happy I stopped by this great place. Tried the Cortland Special and fell in love. Tasty grilled chicken, fresh artichoke hearts and delicious pesto. Liked it so much I ordered a few pizzas for my next meeting at work. Slices were still hot when they were delivered  to the office downtown. My company will be ordering from them again for our next meeting! Cheers to Pizza Express!
author: Katherine W.

description:
Decent pizza. I only have delivery which for me was quick all 4 times. 
I have only ordered cheese pizza's..
A little too much cheese for me. 
The sauce has a lot of oregano in it. 
The people taking the phone orders were very pleasant. 
I would get it again in a pinch.
author: Robert O.

description: Very acceptable pizza. Only big problem is that the toppings to crust ratio is too high for the more elaborate pizzas -- crust gets soggy... yuck.
author: Derrick L.

description: Its a small place with amazing employees.  The whole time I was there it was nice seeing how well they work together. Great team work. Oh and best of all amazing pizza and salad. We will be back, the lady in the front was with a great attitude always :-) & multitasking.
author: Mari B.

description: Decent to good pizza. Friendly service.
author: Jennifer S.

description: New update! I like them again. Whoever used to work there doesn't anymore! Friendly fast, delicious pizza that delivers! Wooohoooo!
author: Gessa C.

description: After they moved locations down the block, seems like the quality improved along with the service. Just ordered a #1 and it arrived in about 30 minutes, hot and delicious. A lil soggy, most like ask for well done next time, but there will be a next time!
author: FILL S.

description:
Just had 2 large pizzas delivered. We tried 2 years ago and not too excited. But NOW we were very happy to have called them. Delivery time was good and the pizza was better. I thought the cheese was great. I have noticed pizza places using cheese lately that does not stretch like pizza when I was a kid. This place does have that cheese Hooray !!!
Toppings were tasty and Greek pizza had red sauce also : )  Will have to try the thin crust next time. Good bye North Beach pizza and Hello Pizza Express.
author: fritz k.

description: Pizza express is the best pizza I've ever eaten. Everything's prepared fresh. Dough is made daily each morning,vegetables cut daily, and they grade there own cheese, all that I've witnessed myself. Sauce is delicious and they have the best tasting dough. If your in the area and want something delicious to eat come here. They also don't charge for delivery so that's a plus. Try the express, cortland, or bernal heights specials because there the best! Thanks pizza express
author: Anwar H.

description: Tried this place for the first time and their pizza is great we love thick crust so we ordered the extra thick crust and the vegetarian combo was super tasty and delivery was faster than they said it would be.  Price is extremely reasonable or what you get.  Will definitely use them regularly!!!
author: Maria R.

description: WOW!!! What an AWESOME pizza! I was so thrilled with the service, delivery, and overall QUALITY of this delicious pizza! I almost couldn't believe the level of professionalism from the delivery man. I have been in San Francisco for 23 years and I cannot believe this is my first go-around with Pizza Express. Keep up the great work- i'll be back soon!
author: Nadia N.

description: This place let's me down every time. Today was the last straw. I literally live around the corner and every time they tell me my two slices of cheese pizza will be ready in "5 minutes." EVERY SINGLE TIME it is ready around 20-25 minutes later. Big wait for mediocre pizza.
author: Jackie C.

description: If I were a zombie (and I am), then pizza express would be a nice, tasty,  and juicy human! You get the point!
author: Pablo H.

description: Very good pizza. I can eat a ton of pizza and all I can handle is two slices. They do not skimp on cheese or meats. The sauce is a little light, yet thick. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants quality pizza near Bernal Heights. The garlic bread isn't what you would expect on garlic bread back East. This is more toasted garlic on top, and tons of it.
author: Ryan H.

description:
So sad to see the decline in service from this Pizza joint, cause I love supporting local businesses in my neighborhood - but I've had enough will this place.

I tried to order a pizza about a week or two ago for delivery. The person who answered the phone did not understand a word I said, while trying to give him my address which he thought was my name. AND instead of putting someone else on the phone - he hung up on me. WTF! 

I called back and said "You just hung up on me", he laughed then apologized. I should have hung up there, but no - I was determined to order a pizza.

I proceeded to finish my order and asked if they had basil. 

HIM: "What is basil?"
ME: It's an herb, you know  - basil. 
HIM: (Nothing)
ME: No? "Okay, it's like a vegetable, leafy, herb...basil"
HIM: "Yes we have that". 

Okay, I am getting somewhere now. Thank goodness...

HIM: "What kind of vegetable do you want? We have lots of vegetables"
ME: "What?"

At that point, I told him to forget it and hung up. I ended up ordering from another place and the pizza was great.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Solid pizza, with generous toppings.  Paul's super friendly and has upheld their tradition of solid neighborhood food for decades.  There's a reason why the neighborhood folks keep coming back.
author: Gregory N.

description:
Decent local, fast pizza place. Cheap ($3 for a slice of cheese, which is really two slices). 

Not gourmet, but that's not what you come here for.
author: Scott H.

description: Probably the best pizza around at a reasonable price. I'll take this over round table any day. Just a regular pepperoni and sausage is good enough on its own
author: Francisco O.

description:
The pizza here is pretty janky from what I remember but they're getting rolled back to 1 star for service this time.

Me and one of my amigos were at the Stray Bar on Cortland yesterday evening crushing some beers and shooting some pool.  My friend asks if I'd eaten yet and I say no, so he orders a large hawaiian from Pizza Express, and they tell us it will arrive in 30 minutes.

45 minutes later we call back, and the stoner hippy who was manning the phones, says that he forgot to place the order, but would give us some free breadsticks if we waited.  We said no, you screwed up and now we don't want it.

How incompetent are the dildos working here that they can't even get a pizza six blocks?  They will never get business from me again.
author: Brad R.

description: Pizza express is amazing. My family has been going here for years and I can see why. Everything is made fresh, their dough is thick and incredible( they also have thin crust available). Their toppings always taste fresh. You can really taste the quality. Their staff is also incredibly nice. Really an all around awesome pizza place.
author: Alex A.

description: One of the best veggie pizza in SF Bay Area!  I love the vegitarian with fresh garlic and pesto!! I suggest getting a large!!
author: Veronica T.

description:
I'm actually pretty shocked to see so many bad reviews about this place.

I used to live right across the street and got slices here once or twice a week.

First of all, I can confirm the staff is a bunch of kids. It's rather annoying because half the time they take about 2 minutes to punch in your order, or they would forget to put my order in, and I'd walk in 10 minutes later and they forgot.

However...

These small downsides are negated by their absolutely DELICIOUS Pizza. By the slice or by the Pie, this is some damn good stuff. The cook once told me that if I put too many toppings on the pizza it won't cook right. That's the first time someone ever told me that.

Every time without failure these pizzas are absolutely out of this world delicious. Worth dealing with the kid staff every time.
author: Zack G.

description:
Average Local Pizza Place.

Ordered Pizza by the Slice, and waited for them to cook it.
This is good because the slice was made fresh (i.e. not pre-cooked sitting around all day), but bad because it took a while (waited almost 15 minutes).

The pizza wasn't thin crust but wasn't really deepish either... some sort of hybrid (maybe about 1" thick?).  For the slice size/thickness, the price was pretty good ($3 per slice).

I personally didn't enjoy the pizza as much as I would have a traditional thin (new york) or deep-dish (chicago) style.
author: Ayall S.

description:
We've ordered delivery from here several times and it's been A-OK each time.  Nothing special, but it's a neighborhood spot, and the only pizza delivery on Cortland.  Now if only they can find our house even though we're just off Cortland.

We always get some kind of combo and you can't go wrong with any of them.  Most of them are meat laden which is good and bad.  Many of the pies are thick and greasy, even the ones with just cheese or veggies.  That may be fine for some of you but I sometimes have to take a paper towel and take off some of the oil.  Toppings are plentiful.

The menu is hard to find on the website, so here's a link to MenuPages

http://sanfrancisco.menupages.com/restaurants/pizza-express/menus.  

Support your local pizza even though it's just average!
author: Michael M.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of thick, chewy crusts.  Pizza Express has thick, chewy crusts.  So, I'm not a huge fan.  However, I do like how they slice up the peppers and onions (long slices, not cubes like Pizza Hut, ick!), their prices are okay (around $15 for a medium with three toppings), and they're pretty fast.  

The place itself leaves something to be desired (definitely dirty), but delivery is not good, either (they messed up my order on a particularly hungry night--not good!).  I would recommend phone ordering for pick up if you live nearby and can't go somewhere else, but I wouldn't say Pizza Express is the best pizza around.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
Oh, man.

I had already given up on Pizza Express when It happened. I had got tired of the multiple times I'd tried to call to order pizza for pickup, only to find that they picked up the phone and then hung up on me (!) or just plain didn't answer. This happened on at least 3 different occasions, multiple tries each time. I was sad about this, because the pizza was pretty good (nice thin crust, New York style, good amount of cheese), even if the sauce was a little too sugar-y.

Then came the night I was standing outside their window, well after closing at night-time, trying to decide whether to walk to Mission to catch a cab or just walk to our next destination. And I saw:

Rats. Scampering over the pizza boxes and over the counters. Two of them at least. 

That's the end of that. I called the Health Department and said I needed to find out how to report a possible violation for a restaurant; they never got back to me. Hence the pages of the Internets.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Came here because we had a groupon. They told me 15-20 minutes for pizza and I came back 25 minutes after I put in the order and the pizza was not ready yet. But that's not what my review is based on. I expected a lot more quality considering the price that they are charging. 
I got a pepperoni pizza and an order of buffalo wings. Wings came from foster farm bag that can be bought at Costco- I saw it in their fridge. The pizza was really disappointing. marinara sauce is thin, salty, and has no flavor. Cheese tasted fake and was sliding off the pizza. The pepperonis was greasy and salty. The crust/dough did not cook properly - failed to rise due to oven not being of sufficient heat. 
While we were eating their supplies came in through the truck- everything is from a box .. Nothing is fresh at this place. I mean what kind of pizza joint doesn't even have a soda dispenser and is unable to offer customer any water. Bottled water and soda can can be bought. Totally unacceptable. Maybe this place really doesn't expect customers to eat there .. Their Business must be all based from deliveries. 
I will definitely not be coming back. Very disappointed.
author: Son-anh D.

description: I love their pizza! They are always my number one choice for pizza delivery. I have been eating here since I was a kid and I never get tired of it. I don't know what it is but I really enjoy their fluffy dough.
author: Des A.

description:
The enormous size, the stack of ingredients at just four for a pie that is, on average steeper in price, more than justifies a score of 4 of 5. 

Delivery for an order at 9:20 arrived at 9:44 for a 6-10 block trip. This place makes a better delivery joint than in house dining. There are few fine pizza places in this city, so Pizza Express serves Bernal very well. 

The table chef recommends warming a stone in the oven when ordering. Keep the pizza hot therein or even bake it a bit more and the crust will crisp.
author: Mark T.

description: It's good 'cos it's local, but I've been here twice and the crust seems to be burned a little every time. The staff usually hang out in front with their cigarettes and that's very detracting to see. The seating could use some updating... lumpy booth seating with lopsided oversized tables. The staff do their job and cook up an alright pie, but don't expect much more than this.
author: Cory M.

description: The mediocrity that is Pizza Express does not justify their rudeness. I ordered from them once, and the driver was very rude about having to to make change. And their sauce tastes like Chef Boyardee.
author: Matt T.

description:
Don't bother if you want timely service.   Ordered 2 hours ago and just called.....

"ummm driver just left 5 min ago - sorry" HANGUP
author: patrick d.

description: Friendly staff, fresh ingredients, and amazing chicken wings! What more can you ask for? Order the express special...highly recommended.
author: Haitham A.

description: I ordered a pizza. Chicken, garlic, and pesto.  The pizza came with the toppings but they left out the cheese. How do you give a person a pizza without cheese...
author: Sara B.

description: This used to be our Go To Pizza place,but after getting very sick Twice...we dropped them forever. That was a few years ago. I hope things have changed. But when food makes you sick....twice....it is a very bad sign.
author: Karen L.

description:
This is my favorite place to get pizza ever. I admit I don't know if this is out of childhood nostalgia or what; I've been getting Pizza Express since I was a little kid.

The slices are enormous triangles of cheese and grease. When I was a kid I would get winded eating one slice. As an adult, 1.5 just about does me in.

The prices are a little steep, but Pizza Express is my guilty pleasure. You can get cheap, so-so pizza anywhere.

I've only ever eaten in the restaurant once, many years ago -- I've always had it delivered -- so I can't really speak on behalf of their service inside the restaurant. No problems with delivery that I can recall.
author: Trish B.

description: There is nothing express about this place. In fact, they should change their name to Pizza Delay. I put my order in & after waiting over an hour & calling then going over two hours... I said forget it! I was so looking foward to getting my pizza. But two hours? They didn't even call me to tell me it was late. How do people like this stay in business?? Really?!
author: jen v.

description: They've been friendly enough whenever I've interacted with them but their pizza's just not that good :(
author: Roxy B.

description:
the pizza arrived without tomato sauce. the buffalo wings arrived without buffalo sauce. delivery took over an hour an a half. when i called, the dude put me on hold and then hung up. i get the impression that with the appropriate sauces the food would be decent. but i can't envision a situation in the future where i'd ever test this hypothesis. 

hey, but at least the coke was cold.  just like the pizza and wings.
author: Laser T.

description:
How can this place stay in business? Pizza Express was fast but that is about all I can say that their name lived up to.... because we didn't eat what we consider qualifies as pizza....... it was a big bread mounds with ketchup and low quality cheese on it. Sauce needs some flavor....crust needs a major reduction in size and please clean the place..........i wanted to shower after picking up my pizza to go.......nasty. 

I don't think the pizza tin they cooked on had ever been washed really no joke. The lady who took my order could have cared less and didn't pass along my order correctly to the guys cooking the dough piles. 

San Francisco needs pizza police .............to bust these non wise guys
author: John F.

description: I have going to this place for years and years--since the 90's. And I did notice a certain drop in service but for me the pizza has been of consistent quality. However recently I went back and was really impressed with the service. I got hooked up with a large pizza when me and my friends only payed for a small. My buddy was really hungry so he wanted to eat it there, granted it was 10 minutes til closing! The girl at the counter said it was fine, which was way too nice, we thanked her for saying we could eat it there but I insisted we let them close up shop. Because I know I want to leave when my shift is over! All in all it was a great experience and I will continue to be a regular and defender of pizza express!
author: Edward W.

description: PPL need to stop hating still some of THE BEST pizza in the city u dont like it go to nasty ass Blondies or that fake ass place on Courtland & mission
author: willie s.

description: I'm an idiot for ordering here but from this day forth, never again.  Pizza is so inconsistent; they never get your order right and delivery (if you are the lucky few that actually receive a delivery) are slow, really slow; usually an hour or longer wait!  It's really that bad, I'm not exagerrating.  This place stinks.
author: K W.

description: My boyfriend found this place on LevelUp and decided to give it a try. It's really hard to find bad pizza, but this is an exception. The pizza seem to be cooked all the way through. Also, the garlic wasn't fresh, and there was A LOT of it. Would not recommend.
author: Kristen O.

description: Good pizza for carry out though. I've never tried their delivery or eating at the place. It's actually too claustrophobic for me. So I just order, wait, and go. Their pizza is good, I don't have any complaints.
author: Nancy T.

description:
I live around the corner, so I never get it delivered, always drop in.  Yeah the place is a dive, and the pizza's nothing special.  But sometimes I just want some decent pie in a divey place.  For me: good crust, right amount of toppings and cheese (not too much cheese as you get some places in SF).  Pizza's comfort food, and I'm pretty happy with a basic, reliable rendering, nothing fancy, most of the time.  Neighborhood pizza.

Tonights pepperoni, onion and anchovy pizza was just the thing.  Delicious.  And the staff was friendly and helpful.  I've never had the kind of problems the other reviewers describe, and until I do, I'll be going back.
author: Timothy J.

description: Called tonight. Ordered a medium pizza. Told to come in 20 minutes. Once I arrived, it was not ready, people were asking for refunds, and no one's pizza was ready . It looked like new personnel. Guess the place is under no management from what I observed. I asked for a refund and informed the cashier that I would never return.
author: Charlie T.

description:
Very nicely done! I was thrown off a bit by the name and I was so hungry and scared I made the wrong choice, lol. But WOW! Fantastic job! 

I got a thin crust pizza, easy on the sauce with pesto, spinach and feta. Mmmmm so good. 

You'll be hearing from me!
author: Chantelle T.

description: After two recent delivery orders, I am confident with a solid 4+ star review. My $17 medium pepperoni and mushroom pizza with delicious! No problems with ordering, delivered in approximately 45 minutes, cheesy, not overly or underdone doughy thick crust. It tasted fresh, and only complaints was that the sauce was sweet, and the pizza was warm - not hot. Don't understand where all the hate is coming from, but I would recommend Pizza Express for simple orders and local delivery.
author: Kate R.

description:
We had some friends over on Saturday night, and I'm so lazy lately (or maybe I just have better things to do than cook) so we ordered some pizzas and salad at Pizza Express. The delivery went a little long, no sign of pizzas over an hour after I placed the order. I called in, and they couldn't find the order! I gave them my credit card number and everything! That made me worry about their card security procedures. (I work for a major bank, in the legal dept., working with just these issues!) Anyways, the guy starts to retake my order and offers me a free 2 liter bottle of soda, because he feels bad. And as he's taking the order, the door bell rings. It's the pizza! They finally arrived! Phew! 

Like other reviewers have said, the pizzas are quite doughy, which I'm not a fan of. The pizza tastes ok, better a few days later with some crushed red pepper sprinkled generously. And the delivery is sketch, as demonstrated above. But we still keep ordering from them....
author: Caroline C.

description: We used to live in this neighborhood many years ago.  We were back in the area to do an errand and decided to go to our fav pizza place when we resided here.  We ordered a half veggie and half ground beef/mushroom and decided to eat in.  The interior is very dated and could use a makeover.  The pizza was good and the staff was friendly.
author: Rpm R.

description:
Pizza Express is one of the few pizza places that sells calzones, which is a huge bonus for me.  The calzone is $18 w/ tax, and enough for 2 (meals or people, take your pick).

Both the pizza and the calzones are really good, IMO.  Crust is a little thick, but is really soft.  Medium amount of cheese.
author: Zachariah B.

description:
I have lived in Bernal Heights for 6 yrs. and never checked out his place, due to several conflicting reviews from locals.
Recently It was convient so My friend and I ordererd up a couple pepperoni slices. We were both suprised the slice was completely covered with above average pep. the sauce was very good and the crust was excellent. I will be back..My suggestion order a  Pepperoni pie w/ extra sauce and crispy (well done) U will not be dissapointed.
author: Phillip G.

description: Too much dough bro. I'd give it one more chance thin crust; but over all it's pretty weak.
author: Richard L. D.

description: Menu has a wide spectrum of choices and all I've tried have been delicious.  The other huge benefit is they do deliver late!  Only minor downside is when you order online, you don't get an estimated delivery time.  If you aren't immediately hungry then this is an excellent establishment to order from.
author: Francesca H.

description:
I just tried ordering a pizza for the night for me and my family (young child). I was told on the phone that it would take 45 minutes. Sounds very fair. I waited for an hour. I called and they told me the pizza had left, so I assumed they were busy and I gave them the benefit of the doubt. I waited another 30 minutes and called to cancel. 1 hour and a half is way too long. I was told about there being only one driver and it was a busy night. I appreciated that Michael called me back to explain the situation, when I called to cancel  before the guy just muttered they were busy and hung up.  I added one star for Michael. I would have not reviewed at all if the following had occured:
1. I had received a phone call that things had been jammed up and deliveries were running late, so I could have had made a plan sooner. 
2. Or if when I called to order I had been told that the night was unusually busy and deliveries in general were taking longer. 

In all that time I could have made dinner or ordered somewhere else. 
Next time just be more straight forward guys.  
I understand busy crazy nights happen and I will give them another chance because of Michael. 
I look forward to updating my review with more positive feedback.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Every once in a  while I get this craving for pizza that I just can't deny. Mind you, I have become lactose intolerant in my old age, and the cheese just wreaks havoc with my internal organs (TMI? Maybe). When I get that hankering, I always order from Pizza Express.
I like there huge selection of specialty pizzas. I am particularly fond of the Cortland Special (which has grilled chicken, artichoke hearts, pesto, garlic, onions, spinach...) and the Aloha ( pineapple, Canadian bacon, bacon, ham....). This brings me to why they only get 3 stars, even though I am a regular customer. There are TOO MANY TOPPINGS! I am all for lots of flavors, but they pile the pizza so high, it is almost impossible to eat. It also seems that there are so many toppings that the middle of the crust never gets completely done and is always a  little soggy.
Great flavor combos, but alot of food.
author: Jamie M.

description:
We try to support local businesses, so although Haystack in Noe is our pizza of choice we throw Pizza Express the occasional bone because they do a pretty good job.

Recently though their prices have shot through the roof, and the other night the pie we went to pick up turned out to be VERY undercooked. We called up and the offered to replace it, and deliver, which they did in a reasonable amount of time. Guess what? The second pie was also undercooked, although not as badly as the first.

C'mon, we want to be supportive of these guys but when the price to ratio quality drops this low, it's time to stop...
author: Neil S.

description: I can't stop thinking about their absolutely filthy bathroom.  Trash overflowing, garbage on the floor, sink filthy, and the faceplate of the bathroom light was BLACK from dirt and worse.  Whoever is using this bathroom, touching the light faceplate, is returning to the kitchen and putting their hands in your pizza dough.  I pointed the bathroom out to the owner who couldn't be bothered to look and told me her employee would clean right away.  30+ minutes later the bathroom had not been touched.  I'm wondering if I'll get sick from eating there tonight.  PLUS, way overpriced!
author: Maureen P.

description: I used to work here back in the  early 90's, back then they had delicious Pizza, and Great service :)p but I was dissappointed when i had ordered it recently .... it was soggy and crust was too huge. When I worked there they had alot of deliveries with hardly any complaints...I am not sure if ramish is still there,but I just hear so many complaints on there service,and there Pizza.....guess Times change.....and cooks! :)
author: Lisa G.

description: Classic neighborhood pizza joint. Quality pizza n friendly staff. Slices are huge too. Usually better to get pie instead of slices tho because they use different sausage for each, n the one they use on the pies are dank!
author: Randy S.

description: I absolutely LOVE their pizza, especially their crust  ;o) Been eating there since I was a kid and will keep on the tradition of stopping by any time we're in SF.
author: Rebecca R.

description: Slow, perpetually confused service- I thought the cashier's boyfriend was just hanging out- turned out to be the cook. When he finally got around to preparing my slice, I was informed that they wouldn't take my card without a $10 minimum charge- RIGHT AFTER MY FRIEND PAID $7 ON A CARD!  When I asked about it, they said "oh 7 or 8 is ok...its the owners rule". I just wish the owner would sort out his sh!t and make it clear to the kids working there. Pizza was sub-par and HUGELY overpriced.  If I want bad pizza and worse service ill go to somewhere cheap in the mission.  Don't try it!
author: Jesse M.

description: My first pizza here was four stars but the second was only two. Their crust is too thick and I thought that both pizzas were undercooked, especially in the thickest part of the crust towards the outside (straight raw dough). I also think that they're a bit overpriced given the location and quality ($30 for a good pie). Only reason that I'm giving three stars instead of two is because they happily take entertainment book coupons.
author: M L.

description: yummy pizza and delivery time was 20 minutes. customer service is great.
author: A C.

description: Yummy pizza that does not disappoint. You can't find too many places that have clam and garlic - they are generous with their toppings (meaning, I hope you aren't kissing anyone after all that garlic).
author: Joy A.

description: In my years as a consumer and patron, I've never walked away from my own money--until I encountered Pizza Express. The BF and I stopped here because we were looking for a quick piece of pizza by-the-slice, which they advertise with a janky sign in the front window. The establishment was less than clean, and when we ordered, they didn't mention that they had no slices available (de rigueur at real pizza by-the-slice establishments). The employee who took our order and money seemed to actually have disdain for all patrons (why were these folks over the phone and at the counter disturbing her Saturday?). The three folks who were taking a collaborative approach to pizza making undertook their task with the same confusion as civilians trying to dismantle an incendiary device. After over 15 minutes of waiting with no information or sign of our slices, we walked out. We determined it wasn't worth our $5 to stay for another minute. At least we got our bottles of water when we paid. Needless to say, they're taking the Bernal/Mission irony thing a little far with their name.
author: Denise A.

description: I order from this place for lunch for the office and I decided to order for dinner last night.  The family loved it.  My brother in law said to me "I can't believe how good this place is, this is what pizza should taste like"  so I decided to yelp.  I knew how good it was but he confirmed it for me.  The buffalo wings were sooooo good.  The best we've had in a while.  They arrived on time, all the food was hot.
author: Nissa Z.

description: Best deal on earth is the half a chicken with a HUGE salad and garlic bread for $9. Its easily 2 meals, cooked absolutely perfectly, juicy, flavorful ... and a pretty decent salad. It's my recession go-to!
author: Brooke B.

description: I have been goin to this place for years at least 10 -15 yrs.. and the past couple of years we would dine in every week. the service WAS great and people friendly...  Since the new ownereship service has been horrible.. received my delivered pizza  a hour later, cold and not cooked all the way thru.. dining in... we no longer do! and to top it off... ordered the other day for delivery.. gave a more than normal tip. ( and we are pretty good tippers).. check my bank statement AND.. someone decided to give themselve a larger tip!  out of all the years ive never had that done...  so with the decline in service, food not tasting so great and the dishonesty... wont be patronizing anymore..
author: Sexy L.

description: I grew up in Bernal Heights and have been going to Pizza Express for about 15+ years.  I think it's one of the best pizza places in the area.  The bbq ribs are actually my favorite thing on the menu.  It comes with garlic bread and salad.  The garlic bread could be a little too hard at times but I like to use it to dip in the extra bbq sauce.
author: Marleen C.

description: I've been going to this place for years and for the most part they do a good job.  The price is right and the food always shows up hot and fresh.
author: Fred R.

description: We ordered a XL cheese pizza and it was horrible ! They must either put too much oregano or garlic in their sauce because it kills the pizza. And I used to love this place
author: CristinaAndErnesto G.

description: This place was fantastic! I went to Pizza Express for my first time and I enjoyed it a lot! One of the employees name Parker and the lady at the cashier was extremely friendly when I was ordering! The slices here are a tad bigger then your average slice. The toppings were plentiful and the crust was just the way I like it! If your looking for some interesting pizza, this is definitely the place to go to!
author: Francisco H.

description: love this place. good pizza fresh ingredients. BP Big portions. goth the combo. been going for over 10 years.
author: Mark F.

description: I always buy pizzas here when my sis and her kids and grandkids visit because they love it.  Just a couple of weeks ago, I ordered 2 and when I went to pick 'em up, I realized that I had totally blown one of the orders; I ordered the wrong one.  Not only did the guy who made them make me a new pizza (the one I really meant to order) but he didn't charge me for it, and still gave me the mistake pizza for free so basically I paid for 2 and got 3, all of which were good.  The guy was just so nice, and you'd better believe it's my go-to place for pizza!
author: Rosa C.

description: This is my all time favorite Pizza place, if they only deliveredd to the East Bay.  The portions are very generous and the ingredients are fresh!  The storefront is nothing to look at, but if you close your eyes and take the bite, you will never regret it.  Fresh is best, once it gets cold well it's still good pizza but hey it's cold!  My favorite is the Meat Lover (this is so loaded that picking it up with your hands may not be an opttions) and Hawaiian (sweet and tangy).
author: Conney P.

description: Pizza Express is a great place in the neighborhood! You get fast service and love their crust! Can't go wrong!
author: Mel P.

description: "This is the BEST Pizza in SF!!!!  It is a thick sourdough crust with lots of sauce and fresh toppings. It is about $18 for a 2 topping large so it is pretty reasonable, and it will fill you up.  You could eat there but it really is more of a delivery or to go place."
author: Enzo S.

description:
This place cracks me up. 

Being a customer of 7 years and knowing it has gone through a few owners, and a lot of employees, I have been finding it a little bit harder to make sure my order is correct (I only have ordered through take out). Last night I ordered a rib dinner. The guy asked me if I wanted beef ribs......okay. Then he proceeded to tell me (slightly annoyed) they don't have beef only pork, we have pork ribs, pork. Uh, okay I will have pork. The End. I actually thought the whole thing was kind of funny. I did thought get my ribs, and they were good. Not great, but good. A LOT of BBQ sauce! I guess that was good to dip the pizza dough garlic bread in. The pizza is good, and yes, it is thick crust and kind of chewy and I find that a good thing....if you like that. 
So, yes, I will still come back because it is a local neighborhood thang and I want to support my hood, but just remember if you like thin crust and BEEF ribs, please go elsewhere!
author: John A.

description: Worst pizza I've had in SF, by a longshot.  I think these other reviewers have this place confused with somewhere that doesn't suck.  And no way is this a sourdough crust.  Seriously, it is worth trekking to just about anywhere else for pizza.
author: Eclipse T.

description: I have been using Pizza Express for many years.  The last 3 times I've been disappointed. The person taking my order left me on the phone while he talked with someone else and then disconnected me. I called back he took the call, but never asked how I was going to pay. The delivery person expected cash and  I planned to use a debit card, but I got the cash. I did not get the thin crust I asked for, the pizza was cold and they did not give me the soda they were giving with a large pizza.  I'm not sure I will call them again.
author: Maggie S.

description: best mediterranean pizza in town...my favorite crust bar-none.  nice and cheesy.  the wings are off da hook too...they got the spicy and bbq ones...nice and plump not skimpy like those other pizza joint yall like too frequent...the perfect combination of cheese meat and dough.   bombest pizza in town...check it out holmes!!!!!
author: Bane V.

description:
When I called to put in a delivery order, the person who answered didn't speak great English, so it was a bit of a challenge.

We ordered their Express pizza with extra jalapeno which wasn't even spicy! The dough was too thick and overall, slightly lacking in flavor. The bbq chicken was smothered in bbq sauce beyond recognition and it was as if it was added after the chicken was grilled (in which case, I which they hadn't bothered). The garlic bread was way too thick and the salad was the usual crap you'd expect from a below-average restaurant: a bunch of tasteless vegetables. 

Overall, huge portions, but bland, tasteless food that lacks any quality.
author: J H.

description: Pizza Express is mediocre at best. I've only had their pizza once and was very underwhelmed. Nothing special here and the crust was just "meh". Heres the thing, if you live in SF you have a vast array of Pizza places to choose from and if I want a pizza I can easily get a great one from several places.
author: Catty C.

description: Go to Giovanni's Pizza instead, you won't ever regret it!
author: Isabella T.

description:
it was good.  not great.

w/ tip a large was $32 -- pricey IMHO.

doughy crust, chewy and fresh.

rich in toppings.  we had the med pizza which came with lots of veggies.

not a whole lot of cheese.

would give a 3.5 stars (if possible)

good delivery, came within 45 mins.
author: Henry F.

description: This place is a few blocks from where we live and while it isn't the most aesthetically pleasing place, the pizza is good and the people who work there and own the place are extremely friendly.  That said, the woman working the cash register is not the friendliest so the owners/management might want to consider someone more personable.  The pizza is very straight forward and not overly greasy and unhealthy so for convenience and a decent pie, this place gets 4 stars.
author: Sheila S.

description:
my husband and i had a hankering for pizza on a sunday afternoon and since amicis decided they no longer deliver to potrero hill, i turned to yelp for some suggestions and came across pizza express.  

the pizza did arrive quickly and was hot, but it was so far from edible that we threw the entire thing away after a couple of bites.  i guess if you are really into thick, doughy crust and lots and lots of cheese, without much sauce this might suit you but i wouldn't think of ordering from here again.  the search for the perfect pizza delivery continues!
author: kate s.

description: I've been going here for over 10 years and have NEVER been disappointed by their pizzas. I hate their chicken wings though. It was oily and just plain nasty tasting. Just focus on getting their pizzas.
author: Jenny A.
